page.title: 14St Kenelm's Close West Brom
page.content: My street is a cul-de-sac. There are eighteen houses and two bungalows. In our street there are loads of children and every night, if it is fine, we will be playing on our bikes. On Sundays there are always lawn mowers going, drills drilling and kids screaming. My next door neighbours own a field. They keep goats, other people's horses and their own Shetland pony called Paddy. Recently Jean reared a goat called Jeffrey; he used to climb up Jane and Zoe's slide, swing on their swing and irritate the rabbits and guinea pig. They are entering the carnival, Paddy will pull a 'wild west' wagon and we will ride as pioneer girls. Nothing exciting happens in my street because it is small but when a man died the news got round very quickly.
